newsitem.title: SWEDEN: S&P rates NIB medium-term note issue at AAA.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates NIB medium-term note issue at AAA.

text.p: U.S. credit ratings agency Standard & Poor's said on Monday that it has rated Nordic Investment Bank's four billion crown medium-term note programme at AAA.
It affirmed its issuer credit rating for the bank at AAA and the short term debt rating at A-1+ and said the outlook was stable.

"The rating reflects prudent statutory and policy limits on the bank's operations, gearing and liquidity, as well as strong membership support and excellent asset and capital quality," S&P said in a statement.
The state-owned Nordic Investment Bank (NIB) provides medium and long-term financing for projects and exports that encourage economic cooperation among member countries.
"The bank's prudent and selective credit policies have largely insulated it from the asset quality problems that have plagued commercial banks in the Nordic region," S&P said.
The agency said the bank's solid membership support and cautious credit policies would were expected to safeguard the bank's excellent asset quality and financial profile.
